document_data.name: Adze
document_data.mainbody: An '''adze''' was a common [[axe]]-like woodworking tool found in [[Faer√ªn]].
document_data.Description: The adze resembled an axe with its head turned sideways, somewhat like a [[mattock]] or [[hoe]]. It could be made with a stone head if necessary, but would be made from a durable metal if at all possible.
document_data.Availability: Adzes were basic tools commonly made by blacksmiths and bought up by carpenters, shipwrights, and anyone else who worked wood.
document_data.Usage:
An adze was an important part of any toolkit for basic woodworking, alongside a [[chisel]], [[hatchet]], [[saw]], [[hammer]], [[nail]]s, a [[plane (tool)|plane]], a [[square]], and a [[ruler]].

An adze could also be used as a clumsy weapon in an emergency, similar to a [[hand axe]],{{Cite dragon/97/Sticks, stones, and bones|10,12}} with shorter-handled varieties used specifically for war.

The ''[[wood shape]]'' spell used a miniature carpenter's adze as a [[material component]].
